sections.title: Dental veneers in Shoreham-by-Sea
sections.body: Veneers are thin restorations placed on the front surface of teeth to refine shape, colour and alignment. They can be an excellent option when the teeth underneath are healthy enough, and when the plan is conservative and carefully staged. We start by understanding what you’d like to change, then assess enamel, bite, gum health and wear patterns so the result is stable and maintainable. In many cases, we can explore minimal-prep or additive approaches, or consider alternatives such as whitening, bonding, or aligners first. If veneers are suitable, we’ll talk through preview options, longevity factors and how to protect the finished work.
bullets: Natural-looking smiles tailored to your face
Minimal-prep options when clinically appropriate
Digital smile planning to preview outcomes
Clear timelines and costs explained before treatment

sections.title: Porcelain and composite veneers with measured preparation
sections.body: Veneers are thin restorations that refine shape, shade, and symmetry. Porcelain veneers are made in the lab for strength and longevity; composite veneers are crafted directly and can be adjusted over time. We keep claims conservative and only recommend veneers when they are the safest option for your teeth.
bullets: Lab-made porcelain veneers for durability and refined translucency
Composite veneers sculpted chairside with the option to revise
Minimal-prep or no-prep approaches considered when enamel allows
Not a whitening shortcut — some discolouration needs other care
We explain pros, limits, and maintenance for each material

sections.eyebrow: Porcelain veneers vs digitally designed / 3D printed veneers
sections.title: Choosing between ceramic longevity and staged printed options
items: Longevity: porcelain is engineered for long-term wear; digitally designed or 3D printed veneers suit staged plans or shorter horizons.
Cost: printed options are more affordable upfront; porcelain reflects laboratory artistry and durability.
Repairability: printed and composite-style veneers can be repaired or refreshed; porcelain often needs replacement if a major chip occurs.
Thickness: porcelain can be ultra-thin yet strong; printed options are conservative but may need a little more thickness for stability.
Aesthetic ceiling: porcelain offers the highest translucency, texture, and colour layering; printed veneers provide a natural upgrade with a modest sheen.
Best suited: porcelain for long-term, high-demand smiles; printed for previews, budget-conscious stages, or when a full smile makeover is still being planned (/treatments/full-smile-makeover).

sections.title: Laboratory porcelain and regulated printed resins
sections.body: Porcelain veneers are hand-layered in the lab with staining, characterisation, and glazing that suit your neighbouring teeth. Printed or milled options use FDA-cleared and CE-marked resins, then are hand finished chairside for gum harmony, bite integration, and a natural sheen.

sections.title: Maintain longevity with mindful care
items: Short-term sensitivity can occur after preparation or fitting
Chipping or debonding is possible — we plan bite to reduce stress
Composite can stain over time; polishing or refreshes may be advised
Gums may need a settling period around new margins
Bite or speech may feel different initially; adjustments are available
Night guards or retainers recommended if grinding or previous orthodontics are factors
Regular reviews and hygiene visits support long-term stability

sections.title: Clear boundaries so results stay predictable
items: Veneers are not maintenance-free — hygiene visits and home care protect the margins and gumline.
Chipping, wear, or staining can happen, especially with strong bite forces or frequent dark foods and drinks.
Night guards are advised for clenching or grinding to protect edges and adhesive bonds.
Printed veneers are a more affordable step but not a lifetime solution; we set expectations for refresh or porcelain upgrades.

We review when whitening, composite bonding, or a full smile makeover may be safer alternatives for your goals (/treatments/teeth-whitening, /treatments/composite-bonding, /treatments/full-smile-makeover).

faqs.question: How long do veneers last?
faqs.answer: Longevity depends on material, bite forces, and maintenance. Porcelain can offer many stable years with night guard protection and reviews; digitally designed or composite-style veneers may need refreshes or upgrades sooner.

faqs.question: How much do veneers cost?
faqs.answer: Costs vary by material and complexity. Printed or composite-style options are the most affordable, while handcrafted porcelain reflects lab artistry and longevity. We outline options and payment plans before you commit.

faqs.question: Am I suitable for veneers?
faqs.answer: Suitability depends on gum health, enamel thickness, bite, and habits. We may recommend whitening, composite bonding, orthodontics, or a full smile makeover instead if coverage is not the safest choice.

faqs.question: What maintenance do veneers need?
faqs.answer: Routine hygiene, non-abrasive home care, and wearing a night guard if you clench all extend veneer life. Printed or composite-style veneers may need more frequent polishing or planned replacement; porcelain benefits from the same protective habits.
